NJ7cTeN4x2t0WHaF.description: Like normal objects, an animated tea cart has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the tea cart takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated tea cart is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 24.

wLRyKa64zoa1vKn9.name: Scald
wLRyKa64zoa1vKn9.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The tea cart ejects piping-hot tea in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]).

Cobblebone Swarm.name: Cobblebone Swarm
Cobblebone Swarm.description:
Graydirge's necromancer-architects used a horrifying rending process to strip the flesh and souls off most bones involved in Graydirge's construction, but modern builders lack the benefit of such gruesomely efficient magic. When haunted bones are embedded in buildings alongside mundane materials, nearby bricks and cobblestones can be infused with necromantic energy. If no one exorcises the spirits haunting the bones, they become trapped and confused, their identities and memories intermingling. After several years, they can form cobblebone swarms, malevolent haunted amalgamations of brick and bone. These vengeful creatures conjure ghostly noises to lure victims down narrow alleys or into dark stone basements, where they pummel them to death and cover their remains beneath piles of bones and brick.

Some have mistaken cobblebone swarms for cobbleswarms, but citizens of Graydirge know to look for nearby apparitions, or studded bones that move when you look away. These are sure signs of a cobblebone swarm, and an indication that one should take a different route to their destination.

Cobblebone swarms look like piles of simple bricks or cobblestones with crooked bones embedded in them, often in the shape of crude faces. As they roll along or float slowly through the air, they leave a ghostly afterimage in their wake.

zGBrolmCtqnMeB9V.name: Hatred for Secret Doors
zGBrolmCtqnMeB9V.description: Cobblebone swarms have a hatred for secret doors, trick drawers, or anything else that conceals hidden spaces, as such things remind them of years or decades spent trapped within stone. They gain a +5 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} secret doors.

mEncHvkwzXvMWRkR.name: Jutting Bones
mEncHvkwzXvMWRkR.description: The cobblebone swarm's space is difficult terrain.

snTIGb2g7DF1L8wx.name: Phantasmal Pummeling
snTIGb2g7DF1L8wx.description: Each foe in the cobblebone swarm's space takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning],1d6[void]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage and 1d6 void damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]).

LpV8movSEB2EyosK.name: Settlement Bound
LpV8movSEB2EyosK.description: A typical cobblebone swarm must remain in the settlement where it originated and can travel no farther than 1 mile from it without falling apart into component pieces, reviving if its pieces are returned to this area. Occasionally, cobblebone swarms are bound to a specific building, road, or district, rather than a settlement.

bWaig98GPFOqqgGh.name: Lancer
bWaig98GPFOqqgGh.description: The skeletal knight uses a lance in one hand, even when it isn't mounted. If the skeletal knight critically hits a creature with its lance Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

Drusilla.name: Drusilla
Drusilla.description:
At first glance, a huldra seems a simple creature-a human in plain robes or peasant dress, sporting long, unbound hair. These tresses and full skirts in fact disguise the huldra's supernatural features: a hollow wooden back, a long bovine tail, and incredible strength.

Folk legends from the lands of the north describe huldras as the creations of troll witches, intended to lure potential meals to the slaughter. Indeed, a huldra's regeneration is so similar to a troll's that a link between the two creatures seems entirely possible, but huldras despise trolls and resent tales suggesting any connection between them. Rather, huldras are wardens of the woodlands they occupy. Grown from saplings by powerful forest-dwelling fey as a response to humanoid encroachment, huldras protect and parley for the forest itself. Woodland creatures adore huldras, and sometimes approach humans or elves thinking they're huldras. This illusion is shattered if the animal sees the humanoid's back is made of flesh or that they're lacking a tail, at which point the animal recoils and runs away.

Huldras respond well to travelers who show respect and deference for the forest, bestowing those they favor with supernatural luck and fortune. Those who scorn or attack a huldra, or those who mock their distinctive, bovine tails, find themselves plagued by poor decisions and even worse luck. Huldras commonly carry a bad reputation as sirens of the deep forest-cunning monsters who seek to lure woodcutters and unwary adventurers to uncertain ends. These stories largely come from miscreants foolish enough to have treated a huldra rudely and later complain about how they were unjustly persecuted. Even woodcutters and hunters can stay in the good graces of huldras provided they plant few trees to replace what they've taken and don't kill any creatures they don't eat.

Though huldras choose to appear unassuming, the attention they put into disguising the supernatural parts of their bodies is sometimes lacking when it comes to their strength. They often perform feats of strength, like bending horseshoes straight or lifting heavy objects, without realizing they're breaking their carefully crafted facade.

ux8vrBZVt7jnRi5F.name: Axan Walk
ux8vrBZVt7jnRi5F.description: Drusilla ignores non-magical difficult and greater difficult terrain within Axan Wood.

BEcAt0SdsvIa6qp9.name: Befuddling Lash
BEcAt0SdsvIa6qp9.description: When Drusilla damages a creature with her tail, a wave of befuddlement clouds the target's thoughts. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

vkQCMGp1H43fc8Jo.name: Manipulate Luck
vkQCMGp1H43fc8Jo.description:
Drusilla touches another creature to manipulate the creature's luck. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. On a failure, Drusilla chooses good luck or bad luck. If she chooses good luck, the affected creature can roll twice on one d20 roll within the next day and use the higher result; this is a fortune effect. If Drusilla chooses bad luck, the creature must roll twice and use the lower result on its next d20 roll; this is a misfortune effect. Once Drusilla has affected a target with Manipulate Luck, that target is temporarily immune to Manipulate Luck from any huldra for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WKQNGK6hd5O7uLC1]{Effect: Manipulate Luck - Drusilla (Good)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zzdOof9hHUf9s13H]{Effect: Manipulate Luck (Bad)}

ae3SxCMfvZIgesia.name: Give Them the Slip
ae3SxCMfvZIgesia.description:
Trigger Dead Faine gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} condition

Effect Dead Faine slips out of his disguise to escape; he removes the grabbed, immobilized, and restrained conditions imposed by the triggering event, then he Steps. If Dead Faine is currently Impersonating, his disguise is ruined, and he's exposed as himself.

WGMIZhZMyM5r1alA.name: Adopt Persona
WGMIZhZMyM5r1alA.description: Dead Faine attempts a Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate}. He doesn't take a penalty to this check due to lacking a disguise kit, to appear as an undead, or to appear as a specific individual.

eO2CyGHELcoHIq2K.name: Feinting Strike
eO2CyGHELcoHIq2K.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Dead Faine is within melee reach of an enemy

Effect Dead Faine Feints, then Strikes the target of his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint}.

KilTEDOADZehIMO5.name: Sneak Attack
KilTEDOADZehIMO5.description: Dead Faine deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures. This increases to 6d6 against creatures off-guard due to Dead Faine's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or Traitorous Betrayal.

OMtaIqvZMW0FPGA3.name: Traitorous Betrayal
OMtaIqvZMW0FPGA3.description: Dead Faine Interacts to draw his dagger and Strikes with it. If the target believes Dead Faine was anyone other than himself, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Dead Faine's attack.

Phalanx of Phalanges.name: Phalanx of Phalanges
Phalanx of Phalanges.description:
Made up of hundreds of finger and toe bones, a phalanx of phalanges clatters along the ground in an eerily uniform manner.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

dvfKEC0Lh8HTPG5D.name: Predetermined Path
dvfKEC0Lh8HTPG5D.description: A phalanx of phalanges knows a single path on even ground no longer than 100 feet, as determined by its creator. The phalanx of phalanges makes no actions other than moving along this path or making Countless Digits attacks against creatures in its way. If impeded on this path or if it takes damage, the phalanx of phalanges is unbound from its path and is permanently berserk, attacking nearby creatures to the best of its ability.

FZwSFqaynmTAfiNW.name: Countless Digits
FZwSFqaynmTAfiNW.description: Each other creature in the phalanx of phalanges' space takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage (@Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]] damage if the swarm is berserk) (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]). On a critical failure, the target is thoroughly pinned by the phalanges, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17) or until any creature uses 2 Interact actions to scrape away the bones pinning them down.

twj4EKcScsSt0E5V.name: Teach You a Lesson
twj4EKcScsSt0E5V.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The members of the mob wildly swing their textbooks and suppliesprimarily spellbooks and stavesin a chaotic attack at each enemy adjacent to the troop (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic]). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(2d12+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(3d12+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

3 @Damage[(4d12+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

DbJuTvhgPXEqgKCk.name: Troop Movement
DbJuTvhgPXEqgKCk.description: Whenever the troop Strides, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

rtzKA1GRO6XUXbNO.name: Troop Spellcasting
rtzKA1GRO6XUXbNO.description: When the necromancer troop Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius isn't affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that's normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

T0tQ5d8VBPe1CC9S.name: Slow
T0tQ5d8VBPe1CC9S.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

6GKslxzXKEVmhTWd.name: Trundling Gore
6GKslxzXKEVmhTWd.description: Mosghuta surges forward at her foe, horn lowered. She Strides once. If she ends her movement within melee range of an enemy, she makes a horn Strike against that enemy. If that Strike succeeds, Mosghuta uses Knockdown as a free action.

pJt9Jjt17jRLK4oP.name: Consume Flesh
pJt9Jjt17jRLK4oP.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[7d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

She also absorbs a portion of the memories once possessed by the creature she fed upon, potentially revealing secrets held by the flesh at the GM's discretion, and also gains a +1 status bonus to all skill checks for 1 minute.

noZrrPatG0HlCOmr.name: Ghoul Fever
noZrrPatG0HlCOmr.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

wWlq8cB7VIQ0GuXZ.name: Paralysis
wWlq8cB7VIQ0GuXZ.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

5GXnNfNwoPtx9p4a.name: Recall Memory
5GXnNfNwoPtx9p4a.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Yurgak focuses her thoughts and recalls a memory from a previously fed-upon corpse. She can attempt to Recall Knowledge using any Lore as if she has legendary proficiency with it ([[/r 1d20+26 #Recall Knowledge]]{+26} on the check).

ZZgCdwFX4QyXLmRV.name: Swift Leap
ZZgCdwFX4QyXLmRV.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

lvyX8fE28Dyfd4Qs.name: Battering Defense
lvyX8fE28Dyfd4Qs.description: The Bellator Mortus uses their shield as both a weapon and a defensive measure. Attempt a shield Strike. If the Strike hits, Raise a Shield.

jeVTUAjLCW0Tbgfl.name: Coordinated Assault
jeVTUAjLCW0Tbgfl.description: The Bellator Mortus acts as part of a well-trained unit. Their Strikes deal an additional 4d6 damage to creatures within reach of at least one of the Bellator Mortus's allies.

Vanth Warrior.name: Vanth Warrior
Vanth Warrior.description: Protecting the Boneyard are the stern and resolute guardians of the dead known as vanths, psychopomps who resemble skeletons with raven-like wings and a mask resembling a vulture's skull. Vanths carry black scythes to fight against those who would disturb the natural progression of souls, and they consider any visitor to the Boneyard a potential troublemaker. When the psychopomp armies go to war, vanths serve as front-line soldiers. They rarely speak and even more rarely show any emotion other than a grim adherence to duty.

nxPfe1yJdSOScSWE.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

de7GnRXapzBCdDoL.name: Infuse Weapon
de7GnRXapzBCdDoL.description: A vanth's scythe is their symbol of office and gains a measure of their personal power. This scythe becomes a +2 striking scythe and is treated as if it were adamantine while the vanth wields it. A vanth whose scythe is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

inmnuN3VcUuUDTaX.name: Reaping Scythe
inmnuN3VcUuUDTaX.description: The vanth throws their scythe, which flies in a @Template[line|distance:60], dealing @Damage[6d8[slashing]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic]) and returns to the vanth's hand.

oBV1Ybwqj4dpXeff.name: Spirit Touch
oBV1Ybwqj4dpXeff.description: A vanth's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[3d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[3d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Sep8lU0AriLntZmy.name: Vanth's Curse
Sep8lU0AriLntZmy.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The vanth bestows a curse on a creature by touching it with their scythe. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Vanth's Curse for 24 hours.

Success The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.

Failure The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}. Each time the target gains the dying condition, the stupefied value increases by 1, to a maximum value of stupefied 6.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is permanent.

Kelganth.name: Kelganth
Kelganth.description:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.

gakDYFEsPKyFUdIg.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

gSG1OZxFHX2zLrNP.name: Counterspell
gSG1OZxFHX2zLrNP.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell Kelganth has prepared

Effect Kelganth expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. Kelganth loses his spell slot as if he had cast the triggering spell.

CjdoOLjRkqyfp25v.name: Rejuvenation
CjdoOLjRkqyfp25v.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

m6CbK52GoU471gez.name: Drain Soul Cage
m6CbK52GoU471gez.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Kelganth taps into his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to 9th rank, even if the spell being cast is not one of his prepared spells. Kelganth's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

O8JRZ8ZAEwNxvyR1.name: Font of Death
O8JRZ8ZAEwNxvyR1.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[11d12[void]] damage in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic]); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

CUwhBzgJAPCU9WcT.name: Paralyzing Doom
CUwhBzgJAPCU9WcT.description: A creature damaged by Kelganth's hand Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[medicine|dc:25] check reveals that the victim is alive.

z7kqAkB367vaH1Zy.name: Quickened Casting
z7kqAkB367vaH1Zy.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Kelganth's next action is to cast an cantrip or spell that is 8th level or less, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

5TLoRDxeWBDh6a6e.name: Steady Spellcasting
5TLoRDxeWBDh6a6e.description: If a reaction would disrupt Kelganth's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

pj2PzMSNP3aGSaFR.name: Stench
pj2PzMSNP3aGSaFR.description:
10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

VFhfoXbwgIId8hxa.name: Consume Flesh
VFhfoXbwgIId8hxa.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[6d6[healing]] Hit Points

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

zGemjvWNZRYrlrdm.name: Ghast Fever
zGemjvWNZRYrlrdm.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

fvNa9q4DAn2iRbMf.name: Paralysis
fvNa9q4DAn2iRbMf.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

G13LX7IIeKwacGfa.name: Sneak Attack
G13LX7IIeKwacGfa.description: The ghast's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

ylEXl7NSakJ1G8mo.name: Swift Leap
ylEXl7NSakJ1G8mo.description: The ghast jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

6TyxpLhpnbTQuAxd.name: Hatred of Red
6TyxpLhpnbTQuAxd.description: Pairakas hate the color red. They won't wear the color or willingly enter any place painted red. Given a choice, they'll attack a creature wearing red first. If barred from expressing their displeasure toward the color by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.

QblktZpnGuwZyRoE.name: Bubonic Plague
QblktZpnGuwZyRoE.description:
A creature can't remove the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} condition while infected

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 fatigued (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage every [[/br 1d20 #Minutes]] minutes (1 day)

3NHzkM0Zz6Qhyfrx.name: Change Shape
3NHzkM0Zz6Qhyfrx.description:
Yshula can take the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid or animal. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage modifiers with the Strikes, but it might change the damage type his strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

UTkWE4ZUCzqoWE6Z.name: Cottage-Drained
UTkWE4ZUCzqoWE6Z.description: Yshula is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and can't recover from his drained condition while he's in the cottage. These reductions are included in his statistics.

O03HMHG7y11WSzQJ.name: Tormenting Dreams
O03HMHG7y11WSzQJ.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Yshula torments a sleeping creature within 100 feet with visions of betrayals by loved ones and friends. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell.

THTZ70glpYi6EuWC.name: Chug
THTZ70glpYi6EuWC.description:
Requirements The brewer is holding a flagon of ale

Effect The brewer Interacts to quickly quaff the flagon's contents. For 1 minute, the brewer gains a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks, damage rolls, and saving throws against fear, but becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zBbmuudbWY8FaOwZ]{Effect: Chug}

OJuNHnHd0dRzaSgt.name: Hasty Impediment
OJuNHnHd0dRzaSgt.description:
Requirements The brewer is adjacent to a barrel, crate, chair, table, or similar wooden object

Effect The brewer heaves the object up to 15 feet and it breaks, sending splinters in a @Template[burst|distance:5]. Each creature in the area of splinters takes @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic]), and the area becomes difficult terrain.

4jCvZADBa2etfzw7.name: Warded Ground
4jCvZADBa2etfzw7.description: The guard designates a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius} area within 30 feet as a protected zone. The guard's Strikes against targets in the protected zone deal an additional 2d6 precision damage.

2VjzSO1Lu2NfxSvA.name: Devastator
2VjzSO1Lu2NfxSvA.description: Grace's Strikes ignore 10 points of a creature's resistance to physical damage.

g08HVYQyr4BtWYzK.name: Celestial Rage
g08HVYQyr4BtWYzK.description:
Requirements Grace isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect Grace unleashes her inner fury. She gains 20 temporary Hit Points that last until her Celestial Rage ends and she casts one divine innate spell or focus spell she knows. While raging, she gains weakness to unholy 10, gains a +10-foot status bonus to her Speed, and takes a -1 penalty to AC. She can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. This Celestial Rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Grace can perceive, or until she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first. When the Celestial Rage ends, Grace can't use Celestial Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Celestial Rage}

K2vHWqScxNJnWnUH.name: Great Cleave
K2vHWqScxNJnWnUH.description: When Grace's melee Strike reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, she can make a melee Strike against another foe adjacent to that creature. If that Strike also reduces the creature to 0 Hit Points, she can continue making melee Strikes until she makes a Strike that doesn't reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points, or until there are no creatures adjacent to the most recent creature she attacked while cleaving, whichever comes first.

5nVE2Xaxc35lkDA5.name: Rhino Charge
5nVE2Xaxc35lkDA5.description: Grace Strides twice; if she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, she can make a melee Strike against that enemy. Grace can Fly instead of Stride if she has a fly speed (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kRsmUlSWhi6PJvZ7]{Angelic Wings}).

Shadow Leydroth.name: Shadow Leydroth
Shadow Leydroth.description:
In ancient times, a cabal of primalists imbued an amalgam of beasts with both supernatural might and a hatred of magic itself, hoping to achieve a potent weapon for use against arcane spellcasters. Effective beyond expectation, the first leydroths broke free and turned on their creators. Worse, the leydroths bred true, and these reclusive predators have long outlived their original creators.

Leydroths look like distorted, apelike felines with many-branching horns growing from the backs of their heads. Their thickly muscled limbs end in glowing claws.

OlwLivQfLQIh0ut7.name: Magic Sense
OlwLivQfLQIh0ut7.description: The leydroth detects the source and school of each source of magic within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

dKevXPU98KPaR2FZ.name: Slink in Shadows
dKevXPU98KPaR2FZ.description: The Shadow Leydroth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

JxE1ccJO8ctrpivc.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

fKqimVsLOPsE2xN0.name: Menace to Magic
fKqimVsLOPsE2xN0.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet Casts a Spell

Effect The leydroth attempts an @Check[intimidation] check to counteract the triggering spell.

Ixt0Bpsg2FgwTGiy.name: Dispelling Roar
Ixt0Bpsg2FgwTGiy.description:
The leydroth unleashes a bestial roar that reverberates within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. It rolls an Intimidation check and compares the result to the Will DC of each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}.

It also uses this result to attempt to counteract each spell or magical effect in the area, plus one item or effect on each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}.

The leydroth can't use Dispelling Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dispelling Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Q3683RHwk5skFzWi.name: Dispelling Strike
Q3683RHwk5skFzWi.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The leydroth hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a Strike

Effect The leydroth casts its innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, targeting one effect on the creature struck.

j4OHhvOuFnXfbDjB.name: Spell Feedback
j4OHhvOuFnXfbDjB.description: Any time a leydroth counteracts a spell or item, the spell's caster or the creature holding the item takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:38|basic] save).

0dTEwPV9TXqDzFno.name: Soulsense 60 feet
0dTEwPV9TXqDzFno.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

fKSG7vK6L1fcFNmE.name: Cowering Fear
fKSG7vK6L1fcFNmE.description:
90 feet. @Check[will|dc:37]

A ravener's frightful presence causes creatures to cower in fear as well. As long as a creature is at least @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or more as a result of the ravener's frightful presence, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} from the fear.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

RyZH5DnpRyQvezrJ.name: Discorporate
RyZH5DnpRyQvezrJ.description:
Trigger The ravener takes excess damage to their soul ward but still has at least 51 Hit Points in their soul ward

Effect The ravener draws deeply into their soul ward, discorporating their body into soul energy in order to escape. They take 50 damage to their soul ward and their physical body vanishes, reappearing [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} later in a random location within 1 mile from the location where they used Discorporate.

lfixSUcyvIdrZqF1.name: Soul Ward
lfixSUcyvIdrZqF1.description:
An intangible field of necromantic energy protects a ravener from total destruction. A soul ward has 150 maximum Hit Points.

Whenever a ravener would be reduced below 1 Hit Point, all damage in excess of what would reduce them to 1 Hit Point is instead dealt to their soul ward. If this damage reduces the soul ward to fewer than 0 Hit Points, the ravener is destroyed.

A soul ward's Hit Points can be restored only via specific ravener abilities such as Consume Soul, ravenous breath, or vicious criticals. A ravener who goes more than a week without successfully using Consume Soul to feed on a dying creature starves, and their soul ward loses [[/r {1d4} #Soul Ward Decay]] Hit Points each day until they feed. If the ravener's soul ward loses all its Hit Points while the ravener still has more than 1 HP, they become a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.Yv0005Vym1peVKHq]{Ravener Husk}.

VThOAv0PEn1ai8J3.name: Consume Soul
VThOAv0PEn1ai8J3.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet of the ravener dies

Effect The ravener tears the creature's soul from its body with their maw and gulps it down. The dying creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save with the same DC as the ravener's Breath Weapon.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The ravener tears off a small chunk of the creature's soul. If the victim is restored to life, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} in addition to any other side effects of returning to life. The ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to half the creature's level.

Failure As success, but the creature's soul is ravaged. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to the creature's level.

Critical Failure As failure, but the ravener devours the entire soul. The victim can't be restored to life as long as the ravener exists except via a 10th-rank effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to twice the creature's level.

SzH0hxHyBlvwORAO.name: Draconic Frenzy
SzH0hxHyBlvwORAO.description: The ravener makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

jprnheEoj1wr3ahE.name: Draconic Momentum
jprnheEoj1wr3ahE.description: The ravener recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

KULBffXE7IRa4JWU.name: Ghost Bane
KULBffXE7IRa4JWU.description: The ravener's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune, and the ravener's jaws deal an additional @Damage[6d6[force]] damage to undead.

SSJYmiOBRjHkg1Qt.name: Ravenous Breath Weapon
SSJYmiOBRjHkg1Qt.description:
The ravener breathes in one of two ways. With either option, a creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). If at least one creature is drained by the ravener's Ravenous Breath Weapon, the ravener's soul ward gains @Damage[5[healing]] HP. The ravener can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Void (necromancy, primal, void) The ravener breathes a blast of darkness in a @Template[cone|distance:40] that deals @Damage[17d6[void],4d6[persistent,void]]{17d6 void damage plus 4d6 persistent void damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic|traits:necromancy,primal,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[22d6[force]] damage instead of the void damage.
  • Shadows (necromancy, primal, shadow) The ravener breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:necromancy,primal,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

    Critical Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

YzCBJTb2mBGfoo0v.name: Vicious Criticals
YzCBJTb2mBGfoo0v.description:
The ravener treats an attack roll as a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, as long as the attack roll was a success. Additionally, whenever the ravener makes a critical hit with one of their Strikes, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save or gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} condition. If the target already has a drained value of greater than 0, their drained value instead increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}. Whenever the ravener applies drain to a creature in this way, their soul ward gains 5 Hit Points.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

dUKNUHl6zUilhtbR.name: Bardic Lore
dUKNUHl6zUilhtbR.description: Sphinxes are naturally curious, and their love of puzzles and mysteries leads them to gather information on a broad range of topics. Sphinxes have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.uVXEZblPRuCyPRua]{Bardic Lore} bard feat, allowing them to Recall Knowledge on any topic.

jW0IBuqnVeRIa4tt.name: Aquatic Assault
jW0IBuqnVeRIa4tt.description: Basiri Swims and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If both she and her opponent are submerged underwater, she can Strike one additional time.

5m851MBF5JZspKoX.name: Harness Wellspring
5m851MBF5JZspKoX.description: Basiri draws upon the necromantic wellspring to power her spellcasting. During her turn, she gains the ability to cast one of the following spells, heightened to 9th rank: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ht35SDf9PDStJfoC]{Spirit Song}.

EGCqTcy88a9ny4va.name: Wellspring Guardian
EGCqTcy88a9ny4va.description: Once per day, Basiri can protect the necromantic wellspring by inscribing a magical sigil around the wellspring orrery. The first time a creature other than Basiri touches the orrery, that creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:41|traits:occult,spell,force,necromancy] save or be affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} (9th).

Sorvinaesen.name: Sorvinaesen
Sorvinaesen.description:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.name: Font of Death
ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d12[void]] damage energy in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.name: Impart Doom
sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.description: A creature hit by Sorvinaesen's claw Strike, or one who critically fails a save from one of Sorvinaesen's spells, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

U9NiBmIUjYGYkzVA.name: Visions of Death
U9NiBmIUjYGYkzVA.description: Sorvinaesen's Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d10[mental]] damage to doomed creatures as visions of their impending deaths fill their minds.

Vampire Guardian.name: Vampire Guardian
Vampire Guardian.hpdetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, void healing

C3OYZgUpNsICPQ9Z.name: Children of the Night
C3OYZgUpNsICPQ9Z.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

dQBobrGFUHBrrW9b.name: Coffin Restoration
dQBobrGFUHBrrW9b.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

dqyPhiS1zVgPGlc6.name: Mist Escape
dqyPhiS1zVgPGlc6.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

ZqZ3RpathLbDe0yK.name: Vampire Weaknesses
ZqZ3RpathLbDe0yK.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Y23JOg9qOtShESZg.name: Change Shape
Y23JOg9qOtShESZg.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +21 attack bonus. These fangs deal the same amount of damage as the vampire's claws, but deal piercing damage rather than slashing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

jpiVScBxbZhkvpcT.name: Create Spawn
jpiVScBxbZhkvpcT.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|against:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

HB6xi0BkiG2sC4sk.name: Dominate
HB6xi0BkiG2sC4sk.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

EUkVu0jdkqrrm4E4.name: Drink Blood
EUkVu0jdkqrrm4E4.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains @Damage[13[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Jq2usNoNnsU6K6FR.name: Sneak Attack
Jq2usNoNnsU6K6FR.description: A vampire guardian deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

gBes2KdIMRvLfNPI.name: Turn to Mist
gBes2KdIMRvLfNPI.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

RRtEbi7LCsYVcq0p.name: Entangling Net
RRtEbi7LCsYVcq0p.description: A Sallowdrudge uses their net to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a Medium or smaller creature within 30 feet. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until it Escapes (DC 16) or until an adjacent creature Interacts to remove the net. On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} rather than grabbed. The Sallowdrudge can't use Entangling Net again until they take 1 minute to refold their net.

YvpiKlId2of8rjcZ.name: Spear Fisher
YvpiKlId2of8rjcZ.description: A Sallowdrudge attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} target rolls the attack roll twice and takes the better result.

D1cMaK9JDg78UTKJ.name: Infused Items
D1cMaK9JDg78UTKJ.description: Pesgahi carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{Antidote (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{Smokestick (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)} (6), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nVvH1ZcM7OwIVIs8]{Frost Vial (Moderate)} (4)

6vv0VDnWbHi1JTse.name: Consume Flesh
6vv0VDnWbHi1JTse.description:
Requirements Pesgahi is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect Pesgahi devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points.

He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

AfDO8pafi2fzO6LF.name: Ghoul Fever
AfDO8pafi2fzO6LF.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

OlYMKu8U3252vjmq.name: Paralysis
OlYMKu8U3252vjmq.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by Pesgahi's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

E0P6jMbhRa8iA1xN.name: Quick Bomber
E0P6jMbhRa8iA1xN.description: Pesgahi can use Interact to draw a bomb and then Strike with it.

4ucQqsarDzmNeEnw.name: Swift Leap
4ucQqsarDzmNeEnw.description: Pesgahi jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

zGqC1f9nAbkhFc9Q.name: Iron Command
zGqC1f9nAbkhFc9Q.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages Seldeg

Effect Seldeg puts an impertinent foe who dared harm him in their proper place. He commands the enemy to kneel in obedience. If they refuse, they must pay the price in pain and anguish. The triggering creature must choose one of the following options: the enemy kneels, dropping @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} as a free action, or the enemy refuses and takes @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage. In addition, Seldeg's Strikes against the triggering creature deal an additional 3 damage until the end of his next turn. Seldeg chooses whether the additional damage is spirit or void each time he uses this reaction.

qUWtbc8MT7AreYzs.name: Rejuvenation
qUWtbc8MT7AreYzs.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

vmaElwLfTTptfaGk.name: Sacrilegious Aura
vmaElwLfTTptfaGk.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}.

QHX8JgZjpxQ71msf.name: Devastating Blast
QHX8JgZjpxQ71msf.description: Seldeg unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of fire. Creatures in the area take @Damage[9d12[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic]). Seldeg can use this ability once every [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

sflDAvsA8PP3Jp11.name: Graveknight's Curse
sflDAvsA8PP3Jp11.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:35] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}

kyx1GW0W2F4XknIb.name: Phantom Steed
kyx1GW0W2F4XknIb.description:
HP 130; AC 39, Fort +28, Ref +25, Will +22

Seldeg summons a supernatural mount as per @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Marvelous Mount} (8th level). Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 levels lower than Seldeg's, and the steed has one-third of Seldeg's Hit Points (rounded down). If the steed is destroyed, Seldeg must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.

gElZJHj913X1orQh.name: Ruinous Weapons
gElZJHj913X1orQh.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Seldeg uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and greater flaming runes.

DOr8AePD22yCeJqd.name: Unyielding Block
DOr8AePD22yCeJqd.description: At the start of each of Seldeg's turns, he gains two additional reactions he can use only to perform a Shield Block.

rJ1opmsaOoIX1hei.name: Weapon Master
rJ1opmsaOoIX1hei.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

Charghar.name: Charghar
Charghar.description:
Common urban legends in Geb warn of the vengeful spirits of those who've been cooked alive, collectively called charghars. While many Gebbites eat people in ways that don't involve cooking, there are some undead who've grown bored after centuries of the same diet. There are also some living people in the nation who've resorted to cannibalism: either downtrodden folks who cook and eat their neighbors and kin out of necessity, or socialites who dine on such fare because it's fashionable. Regardless of the reason for cooking people, these efforts can create vengeful undead creatures who lurk wherever meals are being prepared, luring cooks into making careless or deadly mistakes.

Charghars have spectral humanoid forms, while their physical manifestations appear much as they did after they were cooked-as charred remains, gory corpses bearing disembodied butchered chunks that float nearby, or loose assemblages of boiled bones.

jSYDiFX6EjzvYaVs.name: Malevolent Mishaps
jSYDiFX6EjzvYaVs.description:
10 feet. The charghar causes clumsiness and uncertainty in those nearby. Each creature that starts its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Success The creature is temporarily immune to Malevolent Mishaps for 1 minute.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the start of its next turn. If the creature is living, the charghar Imparts Fears.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

qCZ93XZdw1VOY0cY.name: Create Spawn
qCZ93XZdw1VOY0cY.description: Any humanoid creature killed by a charghar and left unburied in the vicinity of a stove, oven, cauldron, or similar object rises as a free-willed charghar at the next dawn.

HHdOAo37LMBn63w4.name: Impart Fears
HHdOAo37LMBn63w4.description:
A living creature that is struck by a charghar's ghostly cookware Strike or fails a saving throw against the charghar's malevolent mishaps must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. A creature affected by Impart Fears can attempt a new saving throw each day to remove the effect.

Success The creature is temporarily immune to Impart Fears for 24 hours.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} each time it ingests anything or takes an action to prepare any food or drink.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and the creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 1.

lGLvct1KPSexucot.name: Wing Buffet
lGLvct1KPSexucot.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature attacks the kapoacinth while the kapoacinth is Swimming

Effect The kapoacinth pushes the triggering creature 5 feet away from them, and the kapoacinth moves 10 feet in the opposite direction. If the triggering creature can no longer attack the kapoacinth from its new location, the attack misses.

dRMCIL9tHEatSIqt.name: Coral Reef
dRMCIL9tHEatSIqt.description: Until the next time they act, the kapoacinth appears to be a lump of coral. They have an automatic result of 31 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as coral.

dFFv9RiIxSIhrXJ6.name: Slow
dFFv9RiIxSIhrXJ6.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

2KvJH5DlBNKZ3xwD.name: Chomp at the Bone
2KvJH5DlBNKZ3xwD.description:
Requirements The zombie horse's previous action was a jaws Strike that dealt damage to its target

Effect the zombie horse makes a second jaws Strike as it violently gnashes its teeth and bites deep into the target's flesh. On a success, the target takes an additional 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

D6B66UdCjYK3Ln2m.name: Feast
D6B66UdCjYK3Ln2m.description: If the zombie horse is adjacent to a helpless or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature, or a deceased creature that died in the past hour, the zombie can feast upon its flesh to heal itself. This restores @Damage[1[healing]] Hit Point. If the creature is alive, the zombie horse deals damage equal to its jaws damage.

Agorron Guard.name: Agorron Guard
Agorron Guard.description:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.name: Dooming Touch
sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.description: The Agorron guard's claws carry the accursed power of their foul gods. A creature hit by the guard's claw Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.name: Font of Death
ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d10[void]] damage energy in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

k4X0vQBrs8WZ3tEV.name: Wicked Blow
k4X0vQBrs8WZ3tEV.description: The Agorron guard makes a Strike with their scythe. A creature damaged by this attack takes @Damage[3d6[bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

9WgYnHqDFHWo4fRp.name: Evasion
9WgYnHqDFHWo4fRp.description: If Rumin rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

gO9cUtoJfSHg4ICC.name: Susceptible to Mockery
gO9cUtoJfSHg4ICC.description:
A character can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} Rumin by mocking the fact that he hasn't yet been turned into a vampire. On a success, in addition to the normal effects, Rumin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical success), but on a critical failure he becomes enraged and gains a +1 status bonus to Strikes and damage rolls against foes for 1 minute, during which time he can't be mocked further.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.APJJCYdq4gNe0PF4]{Effect: Susceptible to Mockery (Critical Failure)}

dZ7gox9bINwa4OaH.name: Sneak Attack
dZ7gox9bINwa4OaH.description: Rumin's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Umbraex.name: Umbraex
Umbraex.description: An umbraex appears at first glance to be a massive, majestic bird, much like a phoenix. Instead of compassion and warmth, however, it seethes with cold and hate. The umbraex is among the largest of the nihilistic undead called darvakkas.
Umbraex.hpdetails: ashen rise, void healing, regeneration 20 (deactivated by fire or holy)

frZzK6aHaPlfGXaG.name: Ashen Rise
frZzK6aHaPlfGXaG.description: When an umbraex is destroyed, its body discorporates into fine ash before being restored, fully healed, [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds} later. An umbraex can't use this ability as long as its remains are within an area consecrated to a good deity or an area of bright light. The umbraex can't use Ashen Rise again for 1 day.

XJj8TQj5hBV0uRCH.name: Entropy's Shadow
XJj8TQj5hBV0uRCH.description: 40 feet. Umbraex leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[8d6[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the vanyver.

nbnYt1tbPjDn1y06.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
nbnYt1tbPjDn1y06.description: An umbraex caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

fUiV7MT5Xkn73xyb.name: Life-Siphoning Screech
fUiV7MT5Xkn73xyb.description:
The umbraex Flies, shrieking as it passes its enemies. Creatures within 20 feet of the umbraex's flight path take @Damage[22d6[mental]] damage depending on their @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is drained 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Shadowbound Monk Statue.name: Shadowbound Monk Statue
Shadowbound Monk Statue.description:
As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.description: Like normal objects, the statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 24.

YoC3A5KlKj0hBnrB.name: Clinging Gloom
YoC3A5KlKj0hBnrB.description: The statue pulls a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} into its grasping shadows. The target takes @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,void]] damage.

MrDa1bcvphzw2x9Z.name: Cowl of Shadow
MrDa1bcvphzw2x9Z.description: Shifting shadows cover the statue. If the statue is dealt at least @Damage[15[vitality]] damage or brought within an area of magical light, the shadows recede, and the statue can't make darkness mote attacks or use Clinging Gloom.

fdDTUkfdrPLfymVP.name: Rejuvenation
fdDTUkfdrPLfymVP.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

mTghTKnayuIycwJ0.name: Sacrilegious Aura
mTghTKnayuIycwJ0.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, Pokmit automatically attempts to counteract it, with a [[/r 1d20+29 #Counteract]]{+29} counteract modifier.

M8mWSrNnMsNwZzlQ.name: Devastating Blast
M8mWSrNnMsNwZzlQ.description: Pokmit unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of cold. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]). The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

wpdkohoMNWXtuIZQ.name: Graveknight's Curse
wpdkohoMNWXtuIZQ.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:44] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

2ESchU6Js7pT2QaM.name: Pike Master
2ESchU6Js7pT2QaM.description: Pokmit's longspear reach increases by 5 feet until the start of his next turn, and he makes a single longspear Strike against any number of creatures. These attacks count toward Pokmit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Nq1Qjxass8BueZBH.name: Pokmit's Discernment
Nq1Qjxass8BueZBH.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Pokmit sizes up the defenses of a creature within 30 feet; he must know the creature is near, but need not be able to see it. Until the start of Pokmit's next turn, Pokmit's attacks against the target ignore any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

yByhPWWyLYMF0xPt.name: Ruinous Weapons
yByhPWWyLYMF0xPt.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Pokmit uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sexud7FdxIrg50vU]{Greater Frost} weapons runes. (These bonuses are included in his statistics above.)

FjGNo0QftZVw5ktJ.name: Weapon Master
FjGNo0QftZVw5ktJ.description: Pokmit has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons he wields.

Afziaka Brute.name: Afziaka Brute
Afziaka Brute.description:
An afziaka brute arises from a horse, bull, or other large animal.

Vrykolakas vampires use animals as tools to carry their spirits when they would otherwise be slain. The animal usually dies as the vampire is reborn, but some live on in painful starvation.

LP83nqMdxD5uhnwW.name: Grave-Bound Guts
LP83nqMdxD5uhnwW.description: While within 100 feet of its vrykolakas's burial ground, an afziaka appears in the natural shape it had when it was a regular animal and can eat normally. When farther away, it doesn't gain sustenance from eating food and eventually starves to death.

pyyhZ6BfNL9ATh0U.name: Hunger Pangs
pyyhZ6BfNL9ATh0U.description: A creature damaged by the afziaka's fangs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute. The creature can remove this condition earlier by consuming at least a handful of raw meat.

Qs8jgNRG7timjSVE.name: Corpse Scent (Imprecise)
Qs8jgNRG7timjSVE.description: The ghoul crocodile can smell humanoid corpses in the water up to 1 mile away.

Vc4GNlil160ibq9a.name: Consume Flesh
Vc4GNlil160ibq9a.description:
Requirements The ghoul crocodile is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul crocodile devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain HP from any given corpse only once.

JMxq3ADBC01HJnMz.name: Death Roll
JMxq3ADBC01HJnMz.description:
Requirements The ghoul crocodile must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The ghoul crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

nrUiJF6RfQWNailR.name: Ghoul Fever
nrUiJF6RfQWNailR.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

JgSmuAF0Y7WGZqxZ.name: Paralysis
JgSmuAF0Y7WGZqxZ.description: Any living non-elf creature hit by a ghoul crocodile's tail must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

7Tej26wp3GwzSdpy.name: Coven
7Tej26wp3GwzSdpy.description: Iron Taviah adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Magic Passage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

r835KgCvkRk0ttPH.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

ZTdFKmaD7Imp3Vkr.name: Magaambya Scar
ZTdFKmaD7Imp3Vkr.description: Taviah has an old injury that sometimes causes her pain. A physical attack on Taviah that scores a critical hit exacerbates the injury in her wounded leg; in addition to the other effects of the critical hit, Taviah is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

ICF4eC8QzWpKC81e.name: Bonds of Iron
ICF4eC8QzWpKC81e.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Iron Taviah can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring from nothingness around a target at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Taviah gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Taviah doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature [[/act escape dc=24]]{Escapes} (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it; the cage has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

ETaugj7PvAqfMfFY.name: Change Shape
ETaugj7PvAqfMfFY.description:
Iron Taviah can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed, or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

aPjHCeJ7PdtCACQB.name: Ritual Specialist
aPjHCeJ7PdtCACQB.description: Iron Taviah has a +2 circumstance bonus to the primary checks to perform a ritual. In addition, she can reduce the number of secondary casters for a ritual by 1. When she does, she must fulfill any requirements for the secondary caster, and she attempts the secondary check normally performed by that secondary caster. She can't replace a secondary caster who is the target of the spell (as in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual).

E6CK2SNJqqGlCXkQ.name: Scattered Coven
E6CK2SNJqqGlCXkQ.description: When the characters meet Iron Taviah, the Graveclaw is at the height of its power. As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Taviah the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-rank occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}.

UIRxk8ZQIc88MUzh.name: Overwhelming Ectoplasm
UIRxk8ZQIc88MUzh.description: An ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune. A creature damaged by an ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save, as the thoughts and emotions of the amalgam's constituent souls invade their mind.

6PugTFezx0IQVLSv.name: Pummeling Barrage
6PugTFezx0IQVLSv.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam attempts a melee Strike against each enemy within the amalgam's melee reach. Each attack counts toward the amalgam's multiple attack penalty but don't increase the amalgam's penalty until it has made all its attacks.

KuQ5KZzju8qEC4Is.name: Spew Ectoplasm
KuQ5KZzju8qEC4Is.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam releases a burst of ectoplasm that deals @Damage[16d6[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic]). On a failed save, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure). Spew Ectoplasm functions as a force effect for the purposes of affecting incorporeal creatures. The ectoplasmic amalgam can't use Spew Ectoplasm again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spew Ectoplasm]]{1d4 rounds}.
